Description: Head of terracotta figure of Eros. A child’s head, probably of Eros, broken from a figure. He has curly hair, front and back, with a braid fore and aft on the top of his head, extending onto his forehead. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt. The flesh areas appear to have a white dressing with signs of a green-grey colour; the hair has traces of a pinkish-red paint.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3369)
